value.name: Bibby Stockholm Barge Suicide Victim Identified As Albanian National
value.description: Asylum seekers are speaking out against the Bibby Stockholm Barge after a series of suicides, revealing that "the boat is like a prison".

value.name: How Joe Biden gave green light to Ireland for Troubles ambush
value.description: The president is fiercely proud of his Irish roots and gave his personal blessing for Dublin’s legal challenge against immunity legislation

value.name: Private sector will pay for HS2 Euston tunnel, Transport Secretary Mark Harper insists
value.description: Transport Secretary Mark Harper has dismissed fears that private developers will refuse to pay for 4.5 miles of HS2 tunnelling works into Euston station.

value.name: Michelle Mone to be sued by newspaper over PPE ‘lies’
value.description: The New European seek reimbursement for legal fees as Tory peer threatens to leak private recording with civil servant

value.name: Private sector AI forum to launch in January, No10 announce
value.description: A new artificial intelligence (AI) opportunity forum to explore private sector adoption of the technologies will launch in the new year.

value.name: Macron defends new French migration law despite political tensions
value.description: The bill underscored Macron's difficulties governing without a parliamentary majority, which he lost last year, as well as the rightward shift in much of Europe as governments try to curb the rise of the far-right by being tougher on immigration.

value.name: Rishi Sunak takes brutal swipe at Ireland after it makes 'misguided' decision
value.description: Prime Minister Rishi Sunak's administration was speaking after it emerged Irish Taoiseach Leo Varadkar planned to sue Britain in a spat over the UK Legacy Act. Aspects of the legislation include a limited form of immunity from prosecution for Troubles ...

value.description: PRIME Minister Rishi Sunak got an early Christmas gift yesterday — as inflation fell. And the surprise slump has boosted hopes of a spring tax giveaway. Experts are now predicting interest rate

value.name: Gateshead council leader's fears over Tyne Bridge delays
value.description: Any further delay to the restoration of the Tyne Bridge will pose a “real danger” of even greater disruption for the people of the North

value.name: Ministers warned of accountability risk over missing WhatsApp messages
value.description: It comes after Penny Mordaunt claims messages between her and former prime minister Boris Johnson had vanished.

about.name: Ministers of the New Zealand Government

value.name: Dublin says it has 'no choice' but to take legal action over UK's Northern Ireland amnesty law - as British government slams the move as 'unnecessary'
value.description: The new Troubles legacy act became law in September and gives conditional amnesties to former soldiers and militants involved in decades of violence.

value.name: Tax cuts coming in 2024 after surprise drop in inflation
value.description: The fall in inflation was driven by lower fuel and energy prices and a slowing in the pace of increase in food prices, the ONS said. Core inflation – which strips out the most volatile elements – also saw a significant reduction, despite unusually high wage growth.

value.name: Tory ministers set to fight for 'every single vote' in Rishi Sunak's by-election test
value.description: Tory ministers have admitted they are fighting “for every single vote” in a fresh by-election test for Rishi Sunak. Voters in Wellingborough voted to oust disgraced MP Peter Bone after being accused of bullying and sexual misconduct in 2012 and 2013.

value.name: 'Phenomenon': Girl, 8, crowned best female chess player at European championship
value.description: Bodhana Sivanandan has made history after defeating a master player 30 years her senior to be crowned the best female player at a Euro championship. | ITV National News

video.name: 'Phenomenon': Girl, 8, crowned best female chess player at European championship

value.name: Peter Bone saga shows Tories are weak, Labour tells Wellingborough voters
value.description: Jonathan Ashworth, out campaigning for byelection, says Rishi Sunak is being ‘pushed around’ by rightwingers Labour’s Jonathan Ashworth has accused the Conservatives of being weak in their handling of the case of the disgraced former MP Peter Bone ...

value.name: New EU anti-migrant deal will help Rishi Sunak ‘stop the boats’, claims French politician
value.description: French MEP Fabienne Keller, of the Renew Europe group, who led the negotiations, insisted the Geneva Convention will be “fully applied” in the so-called waiting zones, adding: “If I may make a comparison, instead of sending people to Rwanda, we are doing it on European soil.”

video.name: New EU anti-migrant deal will help Rishi Sunak ‘stop the boats’, claims French politician

value.name: Wellingborough byelection gives Labour another chance to humiliate Rishi Sunak
value.description: Recall of MP Peter Bone opens up Brexit-leaning former safe seat where defections from Tories in any direction could help Labour win

value.name: Government sparks anger and ridicule with multi-million pound 'Network North' road project... for London
value.description: Rishi Sunak had pledged to use Network North to "join up our great towns and cities in the North and the Midlands". But the latest announcement from the scheme is to fix the capital's roads.

value.name: Cost of living crisis: Slowing inflation 'nothing to do with Tories', says Iceland boss Richard Walker
value.description: Richard Walker said it was "unedifying to see Rishi [Sunak] celebrating that he has single-handedly halved inflation when, of course, we know it's nothing to do with him - it's the Bank of England and global economic factors".

video.name: Cost of living crisis: Slowing inflation 'nothing to do with Tories', says Iceland boss Richard Walker

value.name: Looking for tips Rishi? Prime Minister Sunak shares a joke with The Thick Of It actress Joanna Scanlan at Downing Street film industry reception
value.description: Scanlan is known for her role as Terri Coverley on the classic BBC comedy, a notoriously useless senior press officer for the Department of Social Affairs and Citizenship.

value.name: 2024 will be the year the housing crisis dwarfs the cost of living
value.description: For Rishi Sunak, the latest sharp drop in inflation was the early Christmas present he’d been hoping for. The dip in the Consumer Prices Index (CPI), from 4.6 per cent to 3.9 per cent last month, means that he will certainly fulfil his new year promise ...

value.name: 2024 will be the year the housing crisis dwarfs the cost of living
value.description: The real story of 2024 may well be that the cost of living crisis will be replaced by a cost of housing crisis. Even if wages finally outpace inflation, and even if some food and energy prices ease, the sheer difficulty in paying a rent or mortgage may further undermine any sense of security.

value.name: ‘Network North’ HS2 savings spent on London pothole repair
value.description: We've confirmed funding for each London borough to ensure millions of road users enjoy smoother and safer journeys. This is only possible due to £8.3 billion of extra investment from redirected HS2 funding, enough to resurface up to 5,000 miles of roads across the country. pic.twitter.com/5JUlQJMsK9
